stem: The nurse provides teaching to a client with Parkinson's disease about maintaining safety and mobility at home. Select the 4 most appropriate instructions to include in the teaching.

options.text: Sleep on a soft, plush mattress for comfort.
Rock back and forth to initiate movement when feeling stuck.
Remove all area rugs from the home.
Practice lifting the toes when stepping (heel-to-toe gait).
Use a walker or cane with a wide base of support.
Look at the feet while walking to ensure proper placement.

rationale.correct: Removing rugs (a) prevents trips. Rocking (b) helps overcome 'freezing'. Assistive devices (d) provide stability. Heel-to-toe gait (e) counters the shuffling tendency.
rationale.incorrect: Looking at feet (c) actually increases the risk of falling by altering balance and forward vision. A firm mattress is better for ease of movement.

answerBreakdown.label: A
answerBreakdown.content: Selecting "Sleep on a soft, plush mattress for comfort." might delay more critical interventions, as it does not address the immediate life-threatening risk.

answerBreakdown.label: B
answerBreakdown.content: The inclusion of "Rock back and forth to initiate movement when feeling stuck." is necessary to address the underlying physiological instability identified during assessment.

answerBreakdown.label: C
answerBreakdown.content: Identifying "Remove all area rugs from the home." is a priority nursing action/finding essential for maintaining patient safety in this scenario.

answerBreakdown.label: D
answerBreakdown.content: Identifying "Practice lifting the toes when stepping (heel-to-toe gait)." is a priority nursing action/finding essential for maintaining patient safety in this scenario.

answerBreakdown.label: E
answerBreakdown.content: Clinically, "Use a walker or cane with a wide base of support." is the most appropriate finding pointing toward the suspected condition and requiring intervention.

answerBreakdown.label: F
answerBreakdown.content: While plausible in other contexts, "Look at the feet while walking to ensure proper placement." is not the highest priority or most relevant factor in this acute scenario.

clinicalPearls: Instruct clients to take several small steps when turning.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: While it seems logical to watch where you're going, in Parkinson's, looking down shifts the center of gravity forward, making a fall MORE likely.

mnemonic.title: R-R-W-H
mnemonic.expansion: Rugs out, Rocking start, Wide base, Heel-to-toe.

reviewUnits.heading: Parkinson's Safety
reviewUnits.body: Nurses focus on gait training and environmental modifications.
